item.title: By: Soohyun Hwangbo
item.dc:creator: Soohyun Hwangbo
item.description: In Korea such secularism is becoming evident - it is a worldwide trend, but in Korea the situation is more explicit, partly due to the stark contrast with the former surge of Christianity that spurred the society and the growing hostility between conservative Christians and 'nones'. I didn't realize there was a separate term for the trend, learned much from the article.
